examples: I assure you.
I assure you that our company has opened our kimono about every aspect of our tax obligations to the state.
The customer service representative assured me that someone would be available to assist me shortly.
I assure you, ma'am, we will stop at nothing to catch that thief.
He felt a sense of relief when the doctor assured him that his stomach issue was temporary.
words.defineEn: to guarantee the occurrence of something
words.defineVi: để đảm bảo sự xuất hiện của một cái gì đó

examples: So the world, at least at that point in time, had avoided a mutually assured destruction.
And we've had a mutually assured destruction, that’s exactly what we got.
Cardboard boxes, KIDS' ARTWORK, Junk Mail go in the Paper Bin, and I feel reasonably ASSURED I am doing it right.
Cardboard boxes, KIDS' ARTWORK, Junk Mail go in the Paper Bin, and I feel reasonably ASSURED I am doing it right.
words.defineEn: displaying confidence in oneself and one's capabilities
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự tự tin vào bản thân và khả năng của một người

words.defineEn: in a way that achieving success or victory is certain
words.defineVi: theo cách mà đạt được thành công hoặc chiến thắng là chắc chắn

examples: The superintendent believed Lancaster's story.
I believed his lies for years.
Scientists believe that a major breakthrough is on the horizon.
Many sports pundits believe the vultures are circling for the team's beleaguered head coach.
His opponents believe he is definitely on the run.
words.defineEn: to accept something to be true even without proof
words.defineVi: để chấp nhận một cái gì đó là sự thật ngay cả khi không có bằng chứng

words.defineEn: to think that a method, idea, etc. is right, acceptable, or effective
words.defineVi: để nghĩ rằng một phương pháp, ý tưởng, vv là đúng, chấp nhận được, hoặc hiệu quả

examples: The company bets its bottom dollar when it spends a lot of money on advertising.
The company hedged its bets by developing a second line of products.
I bet his ears are burning right now.
She hedged her bets by applying for various other jobs as well.
The pilot's best bet was to make an emergency landing.
words.defineEn: used to express that one is sure about something or thinks that something is very likely
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện rằng một người chắc chắn về điều gì đó hoặc nghĩ rằng điều gì đó rất có thể xảy ra

words.defineEn: without a doubt; used to show certainty
words.defineVi: không nghi ngờ gì; dùng để thể hiện sự chắc chắn

examples: The company is growing by leaps and bounds this year.
Even though she was fully aware of the risks, Susan refused to take the necessary precautions to prevent the spread of a contagious disease, proving that selfishness knows no bound.
It's bounded.
In 1529, another treaty set bounds for each country in the Indian Ocean and Pacific regions.
So the difference for Trump’s inauguration was leaps and bounds.
words.defineEn: likely to happen or sure to experience something
words.defineVi: có khả năng xảy ra hoặc chắc chắn để trải nghiệm một cái gì đó

examples: Controlling their buoyancy.
His buoyancy is equivalent.
That’s buoyancy.
Tiny hairs on their legs trap air bubbles and increase their buoyancy.
That force of buoyancy pushes up on each ring, until it matches the downward force of gravity.
words.defineEn: a feeling of hopefulness and confidence that makes one remain cheerful, especially in sad or unpleasant situations
words.defineVi: một cảm giác hy vọng và tự tin khiến một người vẫn vui vẻ, đặc biệt là trong những tình huống buồn hoặc khó chịu

examples: You would probably be negatively buoyant inside here.
A buoyant object will always be pushed up the liquid to the highest point on a meniscus.
A buoyant object will always repel something held up by surface tension’s stretchy membrane.
They’re naturally negatively buoyant, meaning they sink in water.
Would you believe that reindeer are buoyant?
words.defineEn: being optimistic and behaving in a cheerful manner
words.defineVi: lạc quan và cư xử một cách vui vẻ

examples: Good wine can make a meal.
95 per cent of the UK can now get superfast broadband.
Exercise can make a big difference to your state of health.
Can the ropes take the strain?
Daytime temperatures can reach 40°C.
words.defineEn: used to express that one denies the possibility of something happening or being the case
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện rằng một người phủ nhận khả năng một cái gì đó xảy ra hoặc là trường hợp

examples: You must have a cast-iron stomach.
You must have a cast-iron stomach if you're eating pickles with peanut butter!
Do you know anyone with a cast-iron stomach?
Cast-iron pans are exceptionally versatile.
If you're willing to do the cleanup, cast-iron pans are a worthwhile addition to any kitchen.
words.defineEn: certain and confident
words.defineVi: chắc chắn và tự tin

examples: Vowels aren’t categorical like this.
There’s no categorical imperative or principle of utility.
Categorical changes are really hard to reverse, once they’ve taken hold.
So, the first formulation of the categorical imperative is about the universality of our actions.
The first formulation of the categorical imperative is often known as the universalizability principle.
words.defineEn: without a doubt
words.defineVi: không nghi ngờ gì

examples: No, this was a dead cert.
Put your money on Thorpe to win, he’s a dead cert.
One candidate, the outgoing Taoiseach and the then leader of Fine Gael, was a cert.
words.defineEn: something that is sure to happen or succeed
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó chắc chắn sẽ xảy ra hoặc thành công

examples: Certain species of fucoid algae serve as habitats for small marine creatures.
As with all diseases, certain groups will be more at risk than others.
The store sometimes offers discounts on certain items.
The distinct taste and texture of kelp are appreciated in certain cuisines around the world.
Certain species of dinoflagellates can create red tides, affecting marine life.
words.defineEn: feeling completely sure about something and showing that you believe it
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hoàn toàn chắc chắn về điều gì đó và thể hiện rằng bạn tin vào điều đó

examples: Now, like induction, abduction doesn’t give us certainty.
There's no certainty as to when.
Sputnik shatters certain American certainties and a sense of security.
Inductive arguments don’t provide you with certainty.
Because before taxes, the only certainty was death.
words.defineEn: the state of being sure about something, usually when there is proof
words.defineVi: trạng thái chắc chắn về điều gì đó, thường là khi có bằng chứng

examples: I’m the 100% metaphysical certitude.
words.defineEn: the feeling of complete certainty
words.defineVi: cảm giác hoàn toàn chắc chắn

examples: Check the remix.
The active ingredient checks the growth of bacteria.
Check the box next to the right answer.
I’ll check the dates.
Any baggage over five kilos must be checked.
words.defineEn: to make sure that a thing is true, correct, present, or in a good condition by examining something
words.defineVi: để đảm bảo rằng một điều là đúng, chính xác, hiện tại hoặc trong tình trạng tốt bằng cách kiểm tra một cái gì đó

examples: Check the remix.
The active ingredient checks the growth of bacteria.
Check the box next to the right answer.
I’ll check the dates.
Any baggage over five kilos must be checked.
words.defineEn: the act of ascertaining the validity, security, or suitability of something by inspecting it
words.defineVi: hành động xác định tính hợp lệ, bảo mật hoặc phù hợp của một cái gì đó bằng cách kiểm tra nó

words.defineEn: to check the wellbeing, truth, or condition of someone or something
words.defineVi: để kiểm tra phúc lợi, sự thật, hoặc điều kiện của một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: Every single hair is checked over by hand.
I have graduate students from some European countries who literally check over their tax forms on their cell phones and say, yes, yes, yes, a djustthis.
There are times when I'm still able to, like, check over every file and just make sure everything matches up because then I can lipread myself and look at the captions.
words.defineEn: examine so as to determine accuracy, quality, or condition
words.defineVi: kiểm tra để xác định độ chính xác, chất lượng hoặc tình trạng

words.defineEn: ‌to carefully inspect or examine something, especially one that consists of different parts
words.defineVi: ‌để kiểm tra cẩn thận hoặc xem xét một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là một cái bao gồm các bộ phận khác nhau

examples: Every single hair is checked over by hand.
I have graduate students from some European countries who literally check over their tax forms on their cell phones and say, yes, yes, yes, a djustthis.
There are times when I'm still able to, like, check over every file and just make sure everything matches up because then I can lipread myself and look at the captions.
words.defineEn: examine so as to determine accuracy, quality, or condition
words.defineVi: kiểm tra để xác định độ chính xác, chất lượng hoặc tình trạng

examples: Not even the most talented athlete is guaranteed a long career.
Blue blood is no guarantee of any particular merit, competence, or expertise.
Winning one game does not guarantee success for the entire season.
If you leave your science project in my way, I can't guarantee I won't step on it!
The talented athlete has it made with a lucrative contract and sponsorships that guarantee their financial security.
words.defineEn: to make sure that something will occur
words.defineVi: để đảm bảo rằng một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra
